alert.note: Alert for Frazier Mountain Communities; Grant Grove Area; Grapevine; Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge; Kern River Valley; Kings Canyon NP; Piute Walker Basin; San Joaquin River Canyon; Sequoia NP; South End of the Upper Sierra; Tehachapi; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 08 at 11:34AM PST until March 12 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Central California below 4,000 feet. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Excessive rainfall from heavy precipitation entering the Central California Interior later on Thursday and into Friday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
